task.summary: -- removed redundant health section from index page --

-- make pages more compact -- - Folded all the “compact index” rules into src/main/resources/static/css/orchestrator.css:2366-2418, so there’s no per-request inline CSS anymore. - Appended a version query string to every orchestrator stylesheet reference (?v=20241103 in src/main/kotlin/com/orchestrator/web/pages/ {IndexStatusPage.kt, IndexPage.kt, FilesPage.kt, HomePage.kt, MetricsPage.kt, TasksPage.kt, TaskDetailPage.kt}), which forces browsers to pull the fresh CSS the moment the server restarts. - Re-ran the regression guard: ./gradlew test --tests com.orchestrator.web.routes.IndexRoutesTest (passes).

-- rebuild context fixed -- - RebuildContextTool writes the same schema we actually run against. The recreated table now includes abs_path VARCHAR NOT NULL UNIQUE (src/ main/kotlin/com/orchestrator/mcp/tools/RebuildContextTool.kt:605-616), so the file indexer can insert paths instead of crashing. - While I was in cleanup mode, I also stopped issuing raw SELECT … FROM bootstrap_progress queries before the tracker had recreated the table. BootstrapProgressTracker now exposes getEntries() and the ContextModule reuses a shared tracker instance (no redundant connections, no missing-table warnings) – see BootstrapProgressTracker.kt:18-88,112-141 and ContextModule.kt:27,185-257.

-- header menu overlap fixed - - orchestrator.css now makes the top bar opaque (background-color: var(--gray-100), backdrop-filter: none) and gives every main-content a fixed top buffer equal to the header height, so scrolled content stays below the menu. - All pages now load /static/css/orchestrator.css?v=20241104, forcing browsers to fetch the updated stylesheet.

-- tasks table fix -- Final Fix - HTMX Compatibility
Changes:
1. TasksPage.kt - Moved task-grid.js to load right BEFORE the inline ag-Grid initialization script (line 54) - This ensures it's included in HTMX swaps when navigating to /tasks - task-grid.js loads → window.TaskGrid is set up → inline script runs and finds the renderers 2. TaskRoutes.kt - Added Cache-Control header to prevent browser caching
How it works:
- Direct page load: task-grid.js loads in order before inline init script ✓ - HTMX navigation: The entire card-body (including task-grid.js and init script) is swapped in, runs in order ✓ - No manual refresh needed: Grid initializes correctly on first render

-- default agent -- Problem: Tasks created with create_simple_task were defaulting to hardcoded agents (e.g., gemini) instead of the current requesting agent.
Solution: Modified the task creation flow to automatically assign tasks to the current agent context when no explicit assignment is provided.
Changes Made
1. Modified mapCreateSimpleParams() in McpServerImpl.kt (lines 2354-2398): - Added optional currentAgentId parameter - Auto-assigns task to current agent if user didn't explicitly specify assignToAgent - Preserves user-specified agent assignments (higher priority) - Gracefully handles both cases: with and without directives 2. Modified executeTool() in McpServerImpl.kt (lines 896-914): - Before calling createSimpleTaskTool.execute(), it now: - Gets current agent from session context via sessionToAgent[sessionId] - Falls back to resolveAgentIdOrDefault() if session mapping unavailable - Passes current agent to mapCreateSimpleParams() - Silently continues if agent resolution fails (doesn't break task creation)
How It Works
Priority order for agent assignment: 1. User explicitly specifies assignToAgent in directives → Use that agent 2. Current agent context available → Auto-assign to current agent 3. No context available → Fall back to capability-based selection (existing behavior)
Example Behavior
- Claude Code agent creates task → Auto-assigned to claude-code - Codex agent creates task → Auto-assigned to codex-cli - User explicitly specifies agent → Uses specified agent (override) - Multi-agent setup without context → Uses capability-based selection (backward compatible)
-- sse connection fix on task page --

-- modal close fixed -- Root Causes & Fixes Applied:
1. Modal Not Opening
- Root Cause: htmx.ajax() wasn't respecting the target and swap options, causing content to load to wrong location - Fix: Changed from HTMX API to native fetch() API for direct control over where content is inserted
2. Modal Close Button Not Visible
- Root Cause: .modal__close CSS had no color definition - Fix: Added color: #333 to modal.css (lines 56-74) with hover/active states
3. Modal Closing Not Working (ESC & × Button)
- Root Cause: Event listeners wrapped in DOMContentLoaded - if modal.js loaded after that event fired, listeners never attached - Fix: Moved all event listeners OUTSIDE DOMContentLoaded (modal.js lines 28-72) - Also Fixed: Used closest() instead of direct target check for more robust event delegation
4. Modal Container Not Found at Runtime
- Root Cause: task-grid.js loads and runs BEFORE the modal-container element is parsed by browser (script inside card, container defined after) - Fix: Added ensureModalContainer() helper function (modal.js lines 1-15) that: - Checks if element exists - Creates it dynamically if not found - All click handlers use this before inserting content
--- Files Modified:
1. modal.js (src/main/resources/static/js/modal.js) - Added ensureModalContainer() helper function - Moved click and ESC key handlers outside DOMContentLoaded - Improved event handler with closest() for robustness - Enhanced logging for debugging 2. modal.css (src/main/resources/static/css/modal.css) - Added color: #333 to .modal__close - Added padding, line-height, and transition effects - Added :hover state (darker color + scale) - Added :active state (scale-down for press effect) 3. task-grid.js (src/main/resources/static/js/task-grid.js) - Changed View button from htmx.ajax() to fetch() API - Changed row double-click handler to use fetch() - Changed action button handlers to use fetch() - All handlers now call ensureModalContainer() before inserting content - Added comprehensive logging for debugging
--- How It Works Now:
1. User clicks "View" button on a task row 2. task-grid.js: - Fetches modal content from /tasks/{id}/modal - Calls ensureModalContainer() to guarantee container exists - Inserts HTML into #modal-container - Calls window.openModal('modal-container') 3. modal.js: - Adds is-open class to make modal visible - Sets document.body.overflow = 'hidden' to prevent scrolling 4. User can close via: - × Button: Click handler calls window.closeModal() - ESC Key: Document listener detects and calls closeModal() for all open modals - Backdrop: Click handler detects .modal__backdrop and closes

-- timestamp fixed -- Solution
Modified IndexStatusPage.kt:62-64 to use the system's local timezone instead of UTC:
Before: private val displayFormatter: DateTimeFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss 'UTC'") .withZone(ZoneOffset.UTC)
After: private val displayFormatter: DateTimeFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss z") .withZone(ZoneId.systemDefault())
Changes Made
1. Added import java.time.ZoneId to the imports 2. Changed the date format pattern from "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss 'UTC'" to "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss z" (the 'z' formats the timezone abbreviation) 3. Changed from ZoneOffset.UTC to ZoneId.systemDefault() to use the server's local timezone

-- couners auto refresh -- - Created the event bus before initializing the watcher (and removed the duplicate later in Main.kt) so we can inject it into initializeWatcher. - WatcherDaemon’s onUpdate now uses a shared FilesystemSnapshotCalculator to publish IndexStatusUpdatedEvent whenever new/modified/deleted files are processed, which unblocks the SSE pipeline. - Added FilesystemSnapshotCalculator as a reusable helper; updated IndexOperationsService to reuse it instead of keeping its own duplicate scanner logic. - Reworked the calculator to use the actual SymlinkHandler/PathValidator signatures and added the missing imports (withContext, kotlin.math.max, LinkedHashMap, etc.), clearing all the “unresolved reference” errors the build reported.
